title: Introduction to Islamic Studies: Foundations of Faith
description: This Darso Tadrees session will provide an in-depth introduction to the foundational teachings of Islam. The session is designed for students who are eager to gain a better understanding of the core principles of Islamic faith, including the essential elements of Iman (faith), worship, and daily practices.
additionalDetails:
The lesson will cover the following key areas:

Introduction to Aqeedah: A breakdown of the key beliefs in Islam, focusing on the Oneness of Allah, the prophethood, and the afterlife.
The Five Pillars of Islam: A detailed explanation of Shahada (faith declaration), Salah (prayer), Zakat (charity), Sawm (fasting), and Hajj (pilgrimage).
Importance of Qur'an and Hadith: Discussing the Qur'an as the primary source of Islamic law and the role of Hadith in complementing the teachings of the Qur'an.
The Role of the Mosque: Understanding the significance of the mosque in a Muslim's spiritual and communal life.
Daily Practices in Islam: An exploration of the daily rituals, etiquette, and guidelines that shape the life of a practicing Muslim.
The session will be conducted with a blend of lectures, Q&A discussions, and interactive activities to encourage active participation from the students. Emphasis will be placed on the practical application of these teachings in daily life, helping students align their actions with Islamic values.

By the end of the session, participants will have a solid foundation in understanding Islamic principles and be better equipped to implement them in their daily lives. The session will also encourage further exploration and deeper study of Islamic texts.

Target Audience:
This session is suitable for students of all levels who are new to Islamic studies or seeking to strengthen their understanding of the basic principles of Islam. It is also beneficial for individuals looking to refresh their foundational knowledge and deepen their faith.


Instructor:
The session will be led by a qualified Islamic scholar with expertise in Aqeedah, Fiqh, and Tafseer, who has extensive experience in teaching at both beginner and advanced levels.

Session Duration: 2 hours
Language: Arabic (with English translations provided as needed)
